  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Filing Party:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.94%;">

  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\fc\97194251455_D11431_1978045\9971-1-aa.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  7 19:43 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="90" height="90" src="g99711bci001.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:16.0pt;">ADVENT SOFTWARE, INC.</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING
OF STOCKHOLDERS</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To Be
Held on May&nbsp;16, 2007</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the Stockholders of Advent Software Inc.:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTICE IS HEREBY
GIVEN that the Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Advent Software,&nbsp;Inc.
(the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Advent&#148;), a Delaware corporation, will be held on Wednesday,
May&nbsp;16, 2007 at 9:00&nbsp;a.m., local time, at Advent&#146;s principal
executive offices located at 600 Townsend Street, San Francisco, California
94103, for the following purposes:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To elect six
directors to serve for the ensuing year and until their successors are duly
elected and qualified.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To ratify the
appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the independent registered public
accounting firm of the Company for the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To transact such
other business as may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment
thereof.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The foregoing items of business are more fully
described in the Proxy Statement accompanying this Notice. Only stockholders of
record at the close of business on March&nbsp;23, 2007 are entitled to notice
of and to vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 18.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All stockholders are
cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting in person. However, to assure
your representation at the Annual Meeting, you are urged to mark, sign and
return the enclosed proxy card as promptly as possible in the postage-prepaid
envelope enclosed for that purpose. Any stockholder attending the Annual
Meeting may vote in person even if he or she has already returned a proxy.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  </td>

  <td width="575" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:431.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#ProposalNo_1_203552">Proposal No.&nbsp;1: Election of
  Directors</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">

  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="575" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:431.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#CompensationDiscusssionAndAnalysi_210914">Compensation
  Discussion and Analysis</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">

  <td width="575" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:431.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><a href="#AvailabilityOfForm10kaAndAnnualRe_020515">Availability of
  Form&nbsp;10-K/A and Annual Report to Stockholders</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="575" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:431.25pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:16.0pt;">ADVENT SOFTWARE, INC.</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">PROXY STATEMENT<br>
FOR ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PROCEDURAL
MATTERS<a name="ProceduralMatters_040314"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General<a name="General_195128"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The enclosed proxy is solicited on behalf of Advent
Software,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Advent&#148;) for use at the Annual Meeting
of Stockholders to be held on Wednesday, May&nbsp;16, 2007 at 9:00&nbsp;a.m.,
local time, and at any adjournment thereof, for the purposes set forth herein
and in the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders. The Annual
Meeting will be held at Advent&#146;s principal executive offices located at <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">600 Townsend Street, San Francisco, California
94103</font>. The Company&#146;s telephone number at that location is (415)
543-7696.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These proxy solicitation
materials were mailed on or about April&nbsp;17, 2007, together with the
Company&#146;s 2006 Annual Report to Stockholders, to all stockholders entitled to
notice of and to vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Record Date<a name="RecordDate_195134"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders of record at
the close of business on March&nbsp;23, 2007 (the &#147;Record Date&#148;) are entitled
to notice of and to vote at the Annual Meeting. As of the Record Date,
26,982,974 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, $0.01 par value (the &#147;Common
Stock&#148;), were issued and outstanding. For information regarding security
ownership by management and by the beneficial owners of more than 5% of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock, see &#147;Beneficial Security Ownership of Management and
Certain Beneficial Owners.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revocability of
Proxies<a name="RevocabilityOfProxies_195135"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any proxy given pursuant
to this solicitation may be revoked by the person giving it at any time before
it is voted upon. A proxy may be revoked by (1)&nbsp;delivering to the
Secretary of the Company at the Company&#146;s principal executive offices a written
notice of revocation or a duly executed proxy, in either case bearing a later
date than the prior proxy relating to the same shares or (2)&nbsp;attending the
Annual Meeting and voting in person (although attendance at the Annual Meeting
will not of itself revoke a proxy). Any written notice of revocation or
subsequent proxy must be received by the Secretary of the Company prior to the
taking of the vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Voting and
Solicitation<a name="VotingAndSolicitation_195137"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Each stockholder is entitled to one vote for each
share of Common Stock held by such stockholder on the Record Date on all
matters properly submitted for the vote of stockholders at the Annual Meeting.
Stockholders do not have the right to cumulate their votes in the election of
directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The cost of soliciting
proxies will be borne by the Company. In addition, the Company may reimburse
brokerage firms and other persons representing beneficial owners of shares for
their expenses in forwarding solicitation materials to such beneficial owners.
Proxies may also be solicited by certain of the </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\fc\100122733912_D11896_1983824\9971-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company&#146;s
directors, officers and regular employees, without additional compensation,
personally or by telephone, telegram, letter, electronic mail, or facsimile.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Quorum;
Abstentions; Broker Non-Votes<a name="QuorumAbstentionsBrokerNonvotes_195139"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The presence, in person or by proxy, of the holders of
a majority of the shares of Common Stock entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting
is necessary to constitute a quorum at the Annual Meeting. A plurality of the
votes duly cast is required for the election of directors. If a plurality of
votes duly cast is not received for the election of a director from our
shareholders, the Board may reconsider whether it should appoint another
director. The Company is seeking the affirmative vote of a majority of the
votes duly cast to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the
independent registered public accounting firm of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the General Corporation Law of the State of
Delaware, an abstaining vote and broker &#147;non-vote&#148; are counted as present and
entitled to vote and are, therefore, included for the purposes of determining
whether a quorum is present at the Annual Meeting; however, broker &#147;non-votes&#148;
are not deemed to be &#147;votes cast.&#148; As a result, broker &#147;non-votes&#148; are not
included in the tabulation of the voting results on the election of directors
or issues requiring approval of a majority of the votes cast and, therefore, do
not have the effect of votes in opposition in such tabulations. Abstaining
votes are deemed to be &#147;votes cast&#148; and will have the effect of votes against
issues requiring approval of a majority of the votes cast; however, only
affirmative votes will affect the outcome of the election of directors and,
therefore, abstentions will not have an impact on the election.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A broker &#147;non-vote&#148; occurs
when a nominee holding shares for a beneficial owner does not vote on a
particular proposal because the nominee does not have discretionary voting power
with respect to that item and has not received instructions from the beneficial
owner.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deadline for
Receipt of Stockholder Proposals<a name="DeadlineForReceiptOfStockholderPr_195141"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholders may present proper proposals for
inclusion in the Company&#146;s proxy statement and for consideration at the next
annual meeting of its stockholders by submitting their proposals in writing to
the Secretary of the Company in a timely manner. In order to be included in the
Company&#146;s proxy materials for the 2008 annual meeting of stockholders,
stockholder proposals must be received by the Secretary of the Company no later
than December&nbsp;18, 2007, and must otherwise comply with the requirements of
Rule&nbsp;14a-8 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the Company&#146;s Bylaws establish an advance
notice procedure for stockholders who wish to present certain matters before an
annual meeting of stockholders. In general, nominations for the election of
directors may be made by (1)&nbsp;the Board of Directors, (2)&nbsp;the
Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee or (3)&nbsp;any stockholder
entitled to vote who has delivered written notice to the Secretary of the
Company not less than 120 calendar days before the one year anniversary of the
date on which the Company first mailed its proxy statement to stockholders in
connection with the previous year&#146;s annual meeting of stockholders, which
notice must contain specified information concerning the nominees and
concerning the stockholder proposing such nominations. Stockholder nominations
to the Board of Directors must meet the requirements set forth in Section&nbsp;2.5<b>  </b>of the Company&#146;s Bylaws. Under these
requirements, nominations for election to the Board of Directors may be made at
a meeting of stockholders by any stockholder who is entitled to vote in the
election of directors and provides timely written notice to the Secretary of
the Company. This notice must contain specified information concerning the
nominee and concerning the stockholder proposing the nomination. In order to be
timely, a stockholder&#146;s notice must be delivered to or mailed and received by
the Secretary of the Company not less than 120 calendar days before the one
year anniversary of the date on which the Company first mailed its proxy
statement to stockholders in connection with the previous year&#146;s annual meeting
of stockholders. For </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\fc\100122733912_D11896_1983824\9971-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a copy of the Company&#146;s
Bylaws, please write to the Corporate Secretary at the Company&#146;s executive
offices set forth above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s Bylaws also provide that the only
business that may be conducted at an annual meeting is business that is: (1)&nbsp;specified
in the notice of meeting (or any supplement thereto) given by or at the
direction of the Board of Directors, (2)&nbsp;properly brought before the
meeting by or at the direction of the Board of Directors, or (3)&nbsp;properly brought
before the meeting by any stockholder entitled to vote who has written notice
delivered to or mailed and received at the Company&#146;s principal executive
offices (no later than December&nbsp;18, 2007 for the 2008 annual meeting of
stockholders), which notice must contain specified information concerning the
matters to be brought before such meeting and concerning the stockholder
proposing such matters.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A copy of the full text of
the Bylaw provisions discussed above may be obtained by writing to the Secretary
of the Company. All notices of proposals by stockholders, whether or not
included in the Company&#146;s proxy materials, should be sent to Advent Software,&nbsp;Inc.,
Corporate Secretary, 600 Townsend Street, San Francisco, California 94103.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CORPORATE
GOVERNANCE<a name="CorporateGovernance_195244"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Board of Directors<a name="BoardOfDirectors_195245"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The primary responsibility
of the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) is to foster the long-term success of
the Company, consistent with its fiduciary duty to stockholders. The Board has
responsibility for oversight of broad corporate policies, formulation of the
long-term strategic, financial and organizational goals of the Company, and
management, which is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the Company.
In fulfilling its role, each director nominee must exercise his or her good faith
business judgment of the best interests of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Governance
Principles, Code of Business Ethics and Conduct<a name="GovernancePrinciplesCodeOfBusines_195246"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has adopted
Corporate Governance Principles. In addition, the Company has adopted a Code of
Business Ethics and Conduct for its directors, officers, and employees,
including its principal executive and senior financial officers. These
materials are available on the Investor Relations section of the Company&#146;s web
site, <i>www.advent.com</i>. If the Board makes any
substantive amendment to this Code of Business Ethics and Conduct or grants any
waiver, including any implicit waiver, from the provisions of the Code to one
of our principal executive or senior financial officers, we will disclose the
nature of the amendment or waiver on Advent&#146;s web site, located at <i>www.advent.com</i>, or in a current report on Form&nbsp;8-K.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director
Independence<a name="DirectorIndependence_195247"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has determined
that </font>all directors other
than Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco are &#147;independent directors&#148; as defined in the
corporate governance listing standards of The Nasdaq Stock Market.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\fc\100122733912_D11896_1983824\9971-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committees of the
Board<a name="CommitteesOfTheBoard_195249"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Board has established three standing Committees to assist it with the
performance of its responsibilities: the Audit Committee, the Compensation
Committee and the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee. The membership
of each committee as of the date of this proxy statement, the number of
meetings held by each commmittee in fiscal 2006 and other descriptive
information is summarized below.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="225" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:168.85pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="41" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:30.55pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Director</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Audit&nbsp;Committee</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.15pt;">
  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="72" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:54.2pt;">
  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12 **</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="129" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:96.95pt;">
  <p align="center" style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="41" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>

</div>

<div style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Chief
Executive Officer.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
purpose of the Actions by Unanimous Written Consent was primarily to approve
equity awards to non-executive employees of the Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit
Committee.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; As of the date of this proxy
statement, the Audit Committee, which has been established in accordance with Section&nbsp;3(a)(58)(A)&nbsp;of
the Exchange Act, consists of Ms.&nbsp;Carlitz and Messrs.&nbsp;Kirsner, Van
Auken and Zuendt, each of whom is &#147;independent,&#148; as defined by the listing
standards of The Nasdaq Stock Market for audit committee members and meets the
criteria for independence under Rule&nbsp;10A-3(b)(1)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act.
The Board of Directors has determined that Ms.&nbsp;Carlitz and Messrs.&nbsp;Kirsner,
Van Auken and Zuendt are &#147;audit committee financial experts&#148; as defined under
the rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;). The Audit
Committee acts pursuant to a written charter adopted and approved by the Board
of Directors, which is available at the Company&#146;s web site, <i>www.advent.com</i>. The Audit Committee is responsible for,
among other things, assisting the Board of Directors in fulfilling its
responsiblities for oversight of (i)&nbsp;the integrity of the financial
statements of the Company, (ii)&nbsp;the compliance by the Company with legal
and regulatory requirements related to financial affairs and reporting, (iii)&nbsp;the
qualifications, independence and performance of the Company&#146;s independent
registered public accounting firm and (iv)&nbsp;the system of internal controls
regarding finance, accounting and legal compliance of the Company. See also &#147;Audit
Committee Report for the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006&#148;.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
Committee.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; As of the date of this proxy statement,
the Compensation Committee consists of Ms.&nbsp;Carlitz and Messrs.&nbsp;Battle
and Roemer, each of whom is &#147;independent&#148; as defined in the listing standards
of The Nasdaq Stock Market. The Compensation Committee acts pursuant to a
written charter adopted and approved by the Board of Directors, which is
available at the Company&#146;s web site, <i>www.advent.com</i>.
For a description of the Compensation Committee&#146;s responsibilities, see the
&#147;Scope of Authority&#148; section under &#147;Compensation Committee Matters&#148;. See also &#147;Compensation
Committee Report for the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006&#148; and &#147;Compensation
Discussion and Analysis&#148;.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate
Governance and Nominating Committee.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; As of the
date of this proxy statement, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
consists of all of the directors other than Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco, each of whom is &#147;independent&#148;
as defined in the listing standards of The Nasdaq Stock Market. The Corporate
Governance and Nominating Committee acts pursuant to a written charter </p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\fc\100122733912_D11896_1983824\9971-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:28 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">adopted and approved by
the Board of Directors, which is available at the Company&#146;s web site, <i>www.advent.com</i>. The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
is responsible for, among other things, (i)&nbsp;overseeing compliance by the Board of Directors and its committees with applicable laws and
regulations, including those promulgated by the SEC and the listing standards
of The Nasdaq Stock Market, (ii)&nbsp;development of general criteria
regarding the qualifications and selection of board members and recommending
candidates for election to the Board of Directors, (iii)&nbsp;developing
overall governance guidelines, (iv)&nbsp;overseeing the performance and
compensation of the Board of Directors, and (v)&nbsp;reviewing and making
recommendations regarding the composition and mandate of Board committees.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Meeting Attendance<a name="MeetingAttendance_202901"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006, the Board of Directors held a total of
eight meetings (including regularly scheduled and special meetings) and took
action twice by unanimous written consent. No incumbent director during the
last year, while a member of the Board of Directors, attended fewer than 75% of
(i)&nbsp;the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors or (ii)&nbsp;the
total number of meetings held by all committees on which such director served.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although the Company does
not have a formal policy regarding attendance by members of the Board at the
Company&#146;s annual meeting of stockholders, the Company encourages, but does not
require, directors to attend. At the time of the Company&#146;s 2006 annual meeting,
all eight members of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors attended the meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Communication with
the Board<a name="CommunicationWithTheBoard_202906"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any stockholder who
desires to contact our Board of Directors may do so by writing to: Board of
Directors, c/o Chairman of Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee,
Advent Software,&nbsp;Inc., 600&nbsp;Townsend Street, San Francisco, California
94103. Communications will be distributed to the Chairman of the Board or the
other members of the Board as appropriate depending on the facts and
circumstances outlined in the communication received.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CORPORATE
GOVERNANCE AND NOMINATING COMMITTEE MATTERS<a name="CorporateGovernanceAndNominatingC_202908"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Process for
Nominating Directors<a name="ProcessForNominatingDirectors_202910"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Corporate Governance and
Nominating Committee is responsible for, among other things, determining the
criteria for membership to the Board of Directors and recommending candidates
for election to the Board of Directors. It is the policy of the Committee to
consider recommendations for candidates to the Board of Directors from
stockholders</font>. Stockholder recommendations for candidates to the Board of
Directors must be directed in writing to Advent Software,&nbsp;Inc., Corporate
Secretary, 600&nbsp;Townsend Street, San Francisco, California 94103, and must
include the candidate&#146;s name, home and business contact information, detailed
biographical data and qualifications, information regarding any relationships
between the candidate and the Company within the last three years, and evidence
of the recommending person&#146;s ownership of the Company&#146;s Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Committee&#146;s general process and criteria for
identifying and evaluating the candidates that it recommends to the full Board
for selection as director nominees are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Committee regularly reviews the composition and size of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
evaluating and identifying candidates, the Committee has the authority to
retain and terminate any third-party search firm that is used to identify
director candidates, and has the authority to approve the fees and retention
terms of any search firm. During 2006, the Company utilized Korn/Ferry
International to assist in identifying potential director candidates but did
not engage any persons identified by such entity and paid fees of less than
$1,000 to Korn/Ferry International.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\fc\100122733912_D11896_1983824\9971-1-da.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:28 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
its evaluation of director candidates, including the members of the Board of
Directors eligible for re-election, the Committee seeks to achieve a balance of
knowledge, experience and capability on the Board and considers (1)&nbsp;the
size and composition of the Board of Directors and the needs of the Board of
Directors and the respective committees of the Board, (2)&nbsp;such factors as
issues of character, judgment, diversity, age, expertise, business experience,
length of service, independence, other commitments and the like, and (3)&nbsp;such
other factors as the Committee may consider appropriate.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>While
the Committee has not established specific minimum qualifications for Director
candidates, the Committee believes that candidates and nominees must reflect a
Board that is comprised of directors who (1)&nbsp;are predominantly
independent, (2)&nbsp;are of high integrity, (3)&nbsp;have broad,
business-related knowledge and experience at the policy-making level in
business, or technology, including an understanding of the financial services
industry and Advent&#146;s business in particular, (4)&nbsp;have qualifications that
will increase overall Board effectiveness and (5)&nbsp;meet other requirements
as may be required by applicable rules, such as financial literacy or financial
expertise with respect to Audit Committee members.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>With
regard to candidates who are properly recommended by stockholders or by other
means, the Committee will review the qualifications of any such candidate,
which review may, at the Committee&#146;s discretion, include interviewing
references for the candidate, direct interviews with the candidate, background
checks by the Committee or by a third party service provider or other actions
that the Committee deems necessary or proper.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Committee will apply these same principles when evaluating Board candidates who
may be elected initially by the full Board to fill vacancies or add additional
directors prior to the annual meeting of stockholders at which directors are
elected.</p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">After completing its review and evaluation of director
candidates, the Committee recommends to the full Board of Directors the
director nominees for selection.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation of
Non-Employee Directors<a name="CompensationOfNonemployeeDirector_202926"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee evaluates and makes
recommendations to the Board regarding the form and amount of compensation for
non-employee directors. Directors who are employees of Advent receive no
additional compensation for service on the Board. Advent&#146;s director
compensation program is designed to enable continued attraction and retention
of highly qualified directors by ensuring that director compensation is in line
with peer companies competing for director talent, and is designed to address
the time, effort, expertise and accountability required of active Board
membership. In general, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee and
the Board believe that annual compensation for non-employee directors should
consist of both a cash component, designed to compensate members for their
service on the Board and its Committees, and an equity component, designed to
align the interests of directors and stockholders and, by vesting over time, to
create an incentive for continued service on the Board.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee annually reviews director
compensation, including, among other things, comparing Advent&#146;s director
compensation practices with those of other public companies of comparable size.
In conducting such review, the committee may, in its discretion, retain the
services of a compensation consultant.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash Compensation.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; Each
non-employee director, other than the Chairman of the Board, receives an annual
retainer of $30,000, and the Chairman of the Board receives an annual retainer
of $40,000. The Chair of the Audit Committee receives an annual fee of $25,000,
and the directors who serve on the Audit Committee receive $15,000 per annum.
The Chair of the Compensation Committee receives an annual fee of $15,000, and
the directors who serve on the Compensation Committee receive $10,000 per
annum. The Chair of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee receives
an annual fee of $10,000, and the directors who serve on the Corporate
Governance and Nominating Committee receive $5,000 per annum.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\fc\100122915852_D11896_1983824\9971-1-dc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:30 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All retainers and fees are paid quarterly in arrears,
and the non-employee directors are eligible for reimbursement of their expenses
incurred in connection with attendance at Board meetings in accordance with
Advent policy.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Equity Award Grants.</font></i></font>&nbsp;&nbsp; The
Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee may recommend changes to the
levels of option grants, which must be approved by the full Board. Effective April&nbsp;1,
2005, each non-employee director became eligible to receive awards under the
2002 Plan of (i)&nbsp;an initial option grant of 30,000 shares upon joining the
Board, which vests over four years, with 25% of the shares vesting after one
year of service and the remainder vesting in equal monthly installments over
the ensuing three years, and (ii)&nbsp;an annual option grant of 12,000 shares
vesting in twelve equal monthly installments. Upon retirement from the Board,
unvested options are canceled and returned to the Plan. On February&nbsp;26,
2007, the Board, upon recommendation by the Corporate Governance and Nominating
Committee, approved the form and amount of revised equity awards automatically
granted to non-employee directors. Effective February&nbsp;26, 2007, each
non-employee director became eligible to receive awards under the 2002 Plan of (i)&nbsp;an
initial one-time grant of 21,000 shares of stock appreciation rights (&#147;SAR&#148;),
upon joining the Board, which vests over four years with 25% of the shares
vesting one year after the date of grant and the remainder vesting in equal
monthly installments over the ensuing three years, and 4,500 shares of
restricted stock units (&#147;RSU&#148;), which vest over four years with 50% of the
shares vesting two years after the date of grant and 50% vesting four years
after the date of grant; and (ii)&nbsp;annual grants of 8,400 shares of SAR&#146;s
and 1,800 shares of RSU&#146;s, which vest 100% one year after the date of grant. In
the event of a merger with or into another corporation, or other change in
control, each non-employee director
shall fully vest in and have the right to exercise all of his or her
outstanding equity compensation (including outstanding stock options, SAR&#146;s,
RSU&#146;s, or performance shares). Upon a director&#146;s retirement from the
Board, the director&#146;s unvested SAR&#146;s and RSU&#146;s are canceled and returned to the
Plan.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-Employee Director
Compensation Table<a name="NonemployeeDirectorCompensationTa_202946"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In May&nbsp;2006, each non-employee director received
their annual option grant of 12,000 shares pursuant to the 2002 Plan. In January&nbsp;2006,
an initial option grant of 30,000 shares was granted to Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner upon
his appointment to the Board.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes compensation of the
non-employee directors during fiscal 2006 with respect to their Board service:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="29" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.8pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Name</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="168" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:125.65pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="59" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.25pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Fees&nbsp;Earned<br>
  or&nbsp;Paid<br>
  in&nbsp;Cash<br>
  $</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<div style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;line-height:11.4pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Option awards consist of
stock option awards. Amounts shown do not reflect compensation actually
received by the non-employee director. Instead, the amounts in the Option
Awards column reflect the dollar amounts recognized for financial statement
reporting purposes for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, in
accordance with SFAS 123R (excluding the impact of estimated forfeitures related
to service-based vesting conditions), and include amounts attributable to
awards granted during and before 2006. Excluding the impact of estimated
forfeitures related to service-based vesting conditions, assumptions made in
the calculation of these amounts are included in Note 9, &#147;Stock Based
Compensation&#148; to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for the fiscal
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;10-K/A filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on
April&nbsp;3, 2007.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\fc\100122915852_D11896_1983824\9971-1-dc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 12:30 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PROPOSAL
NO. 1<a name="ProposalNo_1_203552"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ELECTION
OF DIRECTORS<a name="ElectionOfDirectors_203553"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Six directors are to be
elected at the Annual Meeting. Unless otherwise instructed, the proxy holders
will vote the proxies received by them for the Company&#146;s six nominees named
below. In the event that any nominee of the Company is unable or declines to
serve as a director at the time of the Annual Meeting, the proxies will be
voted for any nominee who shall be designated by the present Board of Directors
to fill the vacancy. It is not expected that any nominee will be unable or will
decline to serve as a director. In the event any nominee is unable or declines
to serve as a director at the time of the 2007 Annual Meeting, the proxies will
be voted for any nominee who may be proposed by the Corporate Governance and
Nominating Committee and designated by the present Board of Directors to fill
the vacancy. All six nominees are currently directors, and all were elected to
the Board by the stockholders at the last annual meeting. After conducting its
evaluation, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee recommended the
election of each nominee to the Board of Directors. The term of office of each
person elected as a director will continue until the next annual meeting of
stockholders or until a successor has been elected and qualified.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information Regarding Director Nominees<a name="InformationRegardingDirectorNomin_203555"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Board of Directors currently has eight members. Terry H. Carlitz and William F.
Zuendt are not standing for re-election. Each of the remaining six Board members
is standing for re-election to hold office until the next Annual Meeting of
Stockholders. The name of and certain information regarding Director Nominees
as of March&nbsp;31, 2007 are set forth below.</font></p>

<div align="center">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Scully has been a
director since October&nbsp;2003 and was appointed Chairman of the Board in December&nbsp;2003.
Mr.&nbsp;Scully currently serves as managing director of SPO Partners&nbsp;&amp;
Co., a private investment firm he co-founded in 1991, and is a director of Plum
Creek Timber Company and the privately-held Hotel Equity Funds. He also is a
Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees at Stanford University and the Vice
Chairman of Stanford Hospital and Clinics. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Scully is
chairman and founder of the Making Waves Educational Program. Mr.&nbsp;Scully
holds an M.B.A. from Stanford University and an A.B. from Princeton University&#146;s
Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco founded
Advent in June&nbsp;1983. She served as Chairman of the Board from November&nbsp;1995
until December&nbsp;2003. Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco currently serves as Chief Executive
Officer and President of the Company since her permanent appointment to the
position in December&nbsp;2003 after serving on an interim basis from May&nbsp;2003.
Previously, she had served as President since founding Advent until April&nbsp;1997
and as Chief Executive Officer until November&nbsp;1999. She serves on the
Advisory Board of the College of Engineering at the University of California,
Berkeley, and is a San Francisco Foundation board member. Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco
holds a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of California at
Berkeley.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Battle has been a
director since June&nbsp;2005. Mr.&nbsp;Battle was the CEO and Chairman of the
Board of Ask Jeeves,&nbsp;Inc. from 2000 to 2005. He was also director of
PeopleSoft,&nbsp;Inc. from 1995 to 2004, and chaired the Transaction Committee
of the Board during its 18 month deliberations regarding the Oracle </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\fc\99234632868_D10181_1981565\9971-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">tender
offer. Mr.&nbsp;Battle is currently a director of Netflix Inc. and of Expedia
Inc. and is Chairman of the Board of Fair Isaac Corporation. He is also a
member of the Board of Directors of the Masters Select family of funds. As a
Senior Fellow of the Aspen Institute, Mr.&nbsp;Battle is a seminar moderator
for the Aspen Institute and has lectured at Stanford Business School,
University of California-Berkeley Business School, the Amos Tuck School at
Dartmouth, and American University. Mr.&nbsp;Battle retired from Andersen
Consulting in 1995, having joined the firm in 1968 and served as a partner from
1978. From 1982 through 1995, he held a series of management positions in the
firm including Worldwide Managing Partner&#151;Market Development and Managing
Partner&#151;U.S. Operations and Planning. He was also a member of the firm&#146;s
Executive Committee, Global Management Council and Partner Income Committee. Mr.&nbsp;Battle
holds an economics degree from Dartmouth College and a M.B.A. from Stanford University.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner has been
a director since January&nbsp;2006. Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner currently serves on the
Boards of Directors of the Bank of Marin, Cool Systems, Inc and Fair Isaac
Corporation. He previously was a member of the Board of Directors of Ask Jeeves,&nbsp;Inc.,
until its sale in July&nbsp;of 2005. Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner was a Partner at Arthur
Andersen in its Audit and Business Advisory Practice for over 25 years through
1993, providing a wide range of professional services, primarily to financial
services firms. Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner then served as Chief Financial Officer and
Head of Barra Ventures at Barra,&nbsp;Inc., a leading investment risk
management services company from 1993 to 2001. Most recently, Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner
was a consultant and interim Chief Operations Officer for Tukman Capital
Management. Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner holds a B.S. degree in economics and an M.S.
degree in accounting from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
Mr.&nbsp;Kirsner was also a general course student at the London School of
Economics.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Roemer has been a
director since March&nbsp;2004. Mr.&nbsp;Roemer served as Chairman of ProQuest
Company from 1998 to 2004, as ProQuest&#146;s Chief Executive Officer from 1997 to
2003, and as President from 1995 to 2001. From January&nbsp;1994 to June&nbsp;1995,
he served as President and Chief Executive Officer of ProQuest Information and
Learning Company. In October&nbsp;1991, Mr.&nbsp;Roemer joined ProQuest as
President and Chief Operating Officer of ProQuest Business Solutions Company
and was promoted to President and Chief Executive Officer of that company in September&nbsp;1993.
Prior to joining ProQuest Company, he was President of the Michie Group, Mead
Data Central from December&nbsp;1989 to October&nbsp;1991. From January&nbsp;1982
to December&nbsp;1989 he was Vice President and General Manager of LexisNexis,
an online information service. Mr.&nbsp;Roemer attended the University of
Cincinnati and completed the Executive Program at the University of Virginia
and the Program for Management Development at Harvard University.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Van Auken has
been a director since September&nbsp;1995. Mr.&nbsp;Van Auken is a Managing
Director of various entities affiliated with Mayfield Fund, a venture capital
firm, which he joined in October&nbsp;1986. Mr.&nbsp;Van Auken is a director of
Montgomery Street Income Securities,&nbsp;Inc., an investment company. Mr.&nbsp;Van
Auken holds a M.B.A. from Stanford University and a B.E.E. from Rensselaer
Polytechnic Institute.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Required Vote<a name="RequiredVote_203607"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As explained in the
section &#147;Information Regarding Director Nominees&#148; above, Ms.&nbsp;Carlitz and Mr.&nbsp;Zuendt
are not standing for re-election. The Company acknowledges with gratitude their
service on the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The six nominees receiving
the highest number of affirmative votes of the shares present or represented
and entitled to be voted for them shall be elected as directors, whether or not
such affirmative votes constitute a majority of the shares voted. Votes
withheld from any director are counted for purposes of determining the presence
or absence of a quorum for the transaction of business, but they have no legal
effect under Delaware law.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">THE BOARD
OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE &#147;FOR&#148; THE NOMINEES LISTED ABOVE.</font></b></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\fc\99234632868_D10181_1981565\9971-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">AUDIT COMMITTEE
MATTERS<a name="AuditCommitteeMatters_203613"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit Committee
Report for the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2006<a name="AuditCommitteeReportForTheYearEnd_203659"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit Committee provides oversight of the Company&#146;s
accounting and financial reporting processes and the audit of the consolidated
financial statements of the Company. The Audit Committee assists the Board in
fulfilling its responsibilities for oversight of the integrity of Advent&#146;s
consolidated financial statements, compliance with legal and regulatory requirements
related to financial affairs and reporting, the independent registered public
accounting firm&#146;s (&#147;auditors&#148;) qualifications, independence and performance,
and Advent&#146;s system of internal controls regarding finance, accounting and
legal compliance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The management of the Company is responsible for
establishing and maintaining internal control over financial reporting and for
preparing the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements. The independent
registered public accounting firm is responsible for auditing the financial
statements. It is the responsibility of the Audit Committee to oversee these
activities. It is not the responsibility of the Audit Committee to prepare or
certify the Company&#146;s financial statements or guarantee the audits or reports
of the independent auditors, nor is it the duty of the Audit Committee to
certify that the independent auditor is &#147;independent&#148; under applicable rules.
These are the fundamental responsibilities of Company management and the
independent auditors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the performance
of its oversight function, the Audit Committee has:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>reviewed
and discussed the audited consolidated financial statements with
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, Advent&#146;s independent registered public accounting
firm, and Advent management;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>discussed
with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, the matters required to be discussed by the
Statement on Auditing Standards No.&nbsp;61 (required communications with audit
committees) and SAS 99 (consideration of fraud in a financial statement audit);</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>discussed
with Advent&#146;s management and with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP the evaluation of
the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting and the audit of the
effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting, as
required by Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>received
the written disclosures and the letter from PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP required
by Independence Standards Board Standard No.&nbsp;1, and has discussed
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP&#146;s independence with them.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based upon these discussions and review, the Audit
Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial
statements be included in Advent&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 for filing with the United States Securities
and Exchange Commission.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\fc\99234632868_D10181_1981565\9971-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Audit Committee is a separately-designated standing audit committee established
in accordance with Section&nbsp;3(a)(58)(A)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act
of 1934. The Committee is composed of four independent directors, Terry H.
Carlitz, James D. Kirsner, Wendell G. Van Auken and William F. Zuendt, each of
whom is an independent director as defined in Rule&nbsp;4200(a)(154) of the
Marketplace Rules&nbsp;of The Nasdaq Stock Market,&nbsp;Inc. and meets the
criteria for independence set forth in Rule&nbsp;10A-3(b)(1)&nbsp;under the
Exchange Act. The Board has determined that each of Ms.&nbsp;Carlitz and Messrs.&nbsp;Kirsner,
Van Auken, and Zuendt qualify as an audit committee financial expert, as
defined in Rule&nbsp;407(d)(5)&nbsp;of Regulation S-K.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-Approval
Policies<a name="PreapprovalPolicies_203808"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Charter of the
Audit Committee, the Audit Committee has to pre-approve audit and permissible
non-audit services provided to the Company by the independent</font> registered public accounting firm. The Audit
Committee may delegate to one or more designated members of the Audit Committee
the authority to pre-approve audit and permissible non-audit services, provided
such pre-approval decision is presented to the full Audit Committee at its
scheduled meetings.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fees to Independent
Registered Public Accounting Firm<a name="FeesToIndependentRegisteredPublic_203809"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table presents fees for professional audit services rendered by
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for the audit of our annual financial statements for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005 and fees incurred for other
services rendered by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP during those periods (in
thousands).</font></p>
