</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
Compensation Committee and Board recommended a grant to Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco for
2007, however she elected not to accept a grant this year.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">**</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Nye resigned
from the Company effective February&nbsp;2007 and no equity awards were granted
to him during 2007.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SAR&#146;s were granted with an
exercise price of $37.14, the fair market value on the date of grant.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Benefits and
Perquisites</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not provide pension arrangements or
post-retirement health coverage for our executives or employees. The benefits
offered to our executive officers are substantially the same as those offered
to all our employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We provide medical and other benefits to executives
that are generally available to other full-time employees, including an
employee stock purchase plan, group term life insurance premiums and a 401(k)&nbsp;plan.
The 401(k)&nbsp;is a contributory defined contribution plan and Advent&#146;s
contributions are based on years of service. Within the first three years of
service, Advent offers a matching contribution equal to 50% of the first 6% of
the participant&#146;s compensation that has been contributed to the plan, up to a
maximum contribution of $3,500. Employees with three to five years of service
receive 100% of the first 1% and 50% of the next 5% of pay deferred, up to the
maximum allowed. Employees with more than five years receive 100% of the first
2% deferred and 50% of the next 4% deferred, up to the annual limit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of our executive
officers participated in our 401(k)&nbsp;plan during fiscal 2006 and received
matching contributions.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Post-Employment
Obligations</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We adopted the Advent Software Executive Severance
Plan (the &#147;Severance Plan&#148;) to provide severance benefits for executive
officers, upon involuntary termination by us in the event of a Company-wide
lay-off, departmental reorganization or significant restructuring of an
individual&#146;s job duties, or following a change of control. The severance plan
protects the Company by providing a standard policy for executive officer
severance rights and ensures that we have consistency and parity among the
executive </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\fc\100133027990_D11896_1984085\9971-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 13:31 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">offices upon the
occurrence of such events. We believe the plan also assures stockholders that
the Company will have the continued dedication and objectivity of the
executive, notwithstanding the possibility or occurrence of a restructuring or
change of control.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Change of control is defined
as: </font>i)&nbsp;the sale, lease, conveyance or other disposition of all or
substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets to any &#147;person&#148; (as such term is used
in Section&nbsp;13(d)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act), entity or group of persons
acting in concert; ii)&nbsp;any &#147;person&#148; or group of persons becoming the &#147;beneficial
owner&#148; (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 of the Exchange Act), directly or
indirectly, of securities of the Company representing 35% or more of the total
voting power represented by the Company&#146;s then outstanding voting securities;
iii)&nbsp;a merger or consolidation of the Company with any other corporation,
other than a merger or consolidation that would result in the voting securities
of the Company outstanding immediately prior thereto continuing to represent
(either by remaining outstanding or by being converted into voting securities
of the surviving entity or its controlling entity) at least 50% of the total
voting power represented by the voting securities of the Company or such
surviving entity (or its controlling entity) outstanding immediately after such
merger or consolidation; or iv)&nbsp;a contest for the election or removal of
members of the Board that results in the removal from the Board of at least 50%
of the incumbent members of the Board.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event of termination
following a change of control, executives will be entitled to severance
payments consisting of: </font>i) continuing payments at a rate equal to his or
her base salary rate, as then in effect, for a period of 12 months from the
date of such termination, to be paid periodically in accordance with the
Company&#146;s normal payroll policies; ii)
all expense reimbursements and any other benefits due to Executive through the
date of termination of employment in accordance with established Company plans
and policies applicable to Executive; iii) Company-paid coverage for a
period of 12 months for the Executives and the Executive&#146;s eligible dependents
under the Company&#146;s health benefit plans (or, at the Company&#146;s option, coverage
under a separate plan); iv) all of Executive&#146;s outstanding stock options (or
other rights to purchase common stock of the Company), SAR&#146;s, restricted stock,
RSU&#146;s, or performance shares, together &#147;Equity Compensation&#148;) on the
termination date, have their vesting accelerated as to 30 months of additional
vesting, which is one-half the normal five year vesting period for an option or
SAR grant; with post-termination exercisability as specified in the applicable
Equity Compensation agreement; and v)&nbsp;receive such other compensation or
benefits from the Company as may be available under Company benefit plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Severance Plan also
provides the foregoing benefits for executive officers who are involuntarily
terminated (other than for &#147;Cause&#148;), with the exception that the vesting of any
unvested Equity Compensation is 12 months. In event of the executive&#146;s death or
disability, the executive or his/her estate will receive six months of base
salary, six months of benefits coverage, and any other compensation or benefit
as required by law.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Tally Sheets/Total
Compensation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation tally sheets for each of the Named
Executive Officers were prepared and reviewed by the Compensation Committee in
2006. These tally sheets affixed dollar amounts to all components of the Named
Executive Officers&#146; compensation, including current pay (salary and bonus),
outstanding equity awards, benefits, perquisites and potential
change-in-control severance payments. The Compensation Committee reviews tally
sheets at least on an annual basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation Committee
believes it is fulfilling the Company&#146;s compensation objectives and in
particular, rewarding executive officers in a manner that supports our strong
pay-for-performance philosophy. Executive compensation is tied directly to the
Company&#146;s performance and is structured to ensure that there is an appropriate
balance between our long-term and short-term performance, and also a balance
between our operational performance and stockholder return. On average, the
total target pay </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\100133027990_D11896_1984085\9971-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 13:31 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:4.5000pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">position
for the Named Executive Officers in 2006 was between the 50</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;and 65<font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;percentile of the
peer group and the average resulting pay mix was 25% in base salary, 20% in
target annual bonus opportunity and 55% in equity grant value. Our 2006
performance relative to this same peer group approximated or exceeded the 50<font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;percentile with respect to: earnings growth
and growth in market capitalization. Based on our track record of strong
performance relative to industry peers and the stated compensation objectives,
management and the Compensation Committee believes the average target pay
position relative to market and pay mix are reasonable and appropriate.</p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Equity Grant Practices</font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation Committee approves all equity grants
to our executive officers. Beginning in 2007, the Company has adopted a policy
to award our annual merit equity grants to all existing employees only during
open trading windows. Additionally, all equity grants will be awarded on the 10</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-3.0pt;">th</font>&#160;business day of the month. In 2007, the annual
merit equity grant for both executive officers and employees were awarded on February&nbsp;14,
2007. The Compensation Committee selected the February&nbsp;date for the annual
equity grant because it coincided with: i) the Committee/Board review of prior
year Company and individual performance; and ii) the approval of other
executive officer compensation decisions (i.e., salary increases, bonus
payments, etc.). Further, the Committee and our Board believe it is a better
practice to approve executive officer grants during a regular meeting, so that
the Compensation Committee members can carefully deliberate our executive
officer&#146;s and CEO&#146;s compensation arrangements.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed above, the
Compensation Committee has created a sub-committee consisting of our CEO for
the purpose of making grants to non-executive officer employees. Grants by the
CEO, which must be within pre-established guidelines based on employee level,
are made subject to an annual equity pool approved by the Board, which for 2006
was approximately 1.1 million shares and for 2007 is approximately 1.0 million.
The CEO and Human Resources Department are required to provide quarterly
tracking updates to the Compensation Committee regarding equity usage. The
grant date for new hire awards is the 10th business day of the month, following
the date of hire.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Tax Considerations</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We believe it is in our best interest, to the extent
practical, to have executive officer compensation be fully deductible under Section&nbsp;162(m).
Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the Code generally provides that publicly-held
companies may not deduct compensation paid to certain of its top executive officers
to the extent that such compensation exceeds $1&nbsp;million per officer in a
calendar year. Compensation that is &#147;performance-based&#148; compensation within the
meaning of the Code does not count toward the $1&nbsp;million limit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have taken steps to
ensure that payments to executive officers under the Corporate Bonus and equity
compensation programs meet the Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;requirements, where
feasible. The Compensation Committee retains the discretion to provide
compensation that potentially may not be fully deductible to reward performance
and/or enhance retention. Stock options granted under our 2002 plan meet the
requirement of 162(m). Currently our bonus plan does not meet the requirements
because it is not shareholder approved. Likewise, RSU&#146;s do not meet the
performance requirement under 162(m). Executive pay at Advent has historically
met the annual compensation limit of Section&nbsp;162(m), and our CEO&#146;s
compensation was within the $1 million limit in 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\fc\100133027990_D11896_1984085\9971-1-dk.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 13:31 2007' -->

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary
Compensation Table<a name="SummaryCompensationTable_215547"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes the compensation for 2006 of our Principal Executive
Officer, Principal Financial Officer and our three other most highly
compensated executive officers.</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="135" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:101.25pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Name&nbsp;and&nbsp;Principal&nbsp;Position</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Stock awards consist of RSU&#146;s. Amounts
shown do not reflect compensation actually received by the named executive
officer. Instead, the amounts in the Stock Awards column reflect the dollar
amounts recognized for financial statement reporting purposes for the fiscal
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, in accordance with SFAS 123R (excluding the
impact of estimated forfeitures related to service-based vesting conditions).
These compensation costs reflect stock awards granted only in fiscal 2006 as no
RSU&#146;s were granted prior to 2006. Excluding the impact of estimated forfeitures
related to service-based vesting conditions, assumptions made in the
calculation of these amounts are included in Note&nbsp;9, &#147;Stock Based
Compensation&#148; to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for the fiscal
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K/A
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on April&nbsp;3, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Option awards consist of stock option, SAR
and Employee Stock Purchase Plan awards. Amounts shown do not reflect
compensation actually received by the named executive officer. Instead, the
amounts in the Option Awards column reflect the dollar amounts recognized for
financial statement reporting purposes for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, in accordance with SFAS&nbsp;123R (excluding the impact of estimated
forfeitures related to service-based vesting conditions), and include amounts
attributable to awards granted during and before 2006. Excluding the impact of
estimated forfeitures related to service-based vesting conditions, assumptions
made in the calculation of these amounts are included in Note&nbsp;9, &#147;Stock
Based Compensation&#148; to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2006, included in the Company&#146;s Annual
Report on Form&nbsp;10-K/A filed with the Securities and Exchange
Commission on April&nbsp;3, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Amounts consist of bonuses earned for
services rendered in fiscal 2006 under the 2006 Executive Short-Term Incentive
Plan and paid in February&nbsp;2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">All other compensation primarily consists
of premiums paid for life insurance where the Company is not the beneficiary,
compensation for sales achievement, matching contributions made by Advent under
the tax-qualified 401(k)&nbsp;Plan, which provides for broad-based employee
participation, amounts paid for health care, parking benefits and health club
membership dues.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Option award compensation for Mr.&nbsp;Nye
includes compensation from options granted in 2002 to purchase 200,000 shares
of common stock. These options were cancelled and reissued in 2003 in
conjunction with the Company&#146;s Stock Option Exchange program.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:7.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">These amounts represent awards payable under the 2006
Executive Short-Term Incentive Plan. Actual amounts paid under the 2006
Executive Short-Term Incentive Plan are disclosed in the Summary Compensation
Table.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The threshold amounts represent the minimum payouts if
both business performance and individual performance are below target levels.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The target amounts represent the potential payout if
both business performance and individual performance are at target levels.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The maximum amounts represents the maximum payouts
under the 2006 Executive Short-Term Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Represents grants of RSU&#146;s.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Represents grants of SAR&#146;s.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The value of a stock or option award is
based on the fair value as of the grant date of such award determined pursuant
to FAS&nbsp;123R.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\fc\10002229234_D10181_1981728\9971-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 00:24 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Outstanding Equity
Awards<a name="OutstandingEquityAwards_222104"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
summarizes all outstanding equity awards held by the named executive officers
at the end of fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
   <td width="152" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:113.8pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="289" colspan="15" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:216.8pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Option&nbsp;Awards</font></b></p>
   </td>

   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Price</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="51" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.5pt;">

   </td>

   </td>

   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">have&nbsp;not</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <p style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.65pt;">
  <p style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="37" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.5pt;">

 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(1) Represents
grants of RSU&#146;s which vest over a four-year period on their second and fourth
anniversaries. The shares will be converted on a one-to-one basis into shares
of Advent common stock immediately upon vesting. Assuming continued employment
with Advent, 50% of these shares will vest on March&nbsp;14</font><font size="1" style="font-size:5.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#160;of each of 2008
and 2010, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(2) Value is based
on the closing price of Advent common stock of $35.29 on December&nbsp;31,
2006, as reported on the Nasdaq Global Select Market.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(3) These options
were granted on February&nbsp;4, 1997. The options vested 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(4) On October&nbsp;17,
2003, options to purchase 100,000 shares were granted. 50,000 of these options
vest in equal monthly installments over the next 60 months after the date of
grant. The remaining 50,000 of options vested on March&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(5) On January&nbsp;2,
2004, options to purchase 200,000 shares were granted. These options fully
vested on January&nbsp;2, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(6) These options
were granted on January&nbsp;28, 2005. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(7) These SAR&#146;s
were granted on March&nbsp;14, 2006. The SAR&#146;s vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(8) These options
were granted on February&nbsp;11, 2003. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(9) On September&nbsp;26,
2003, options to purchase 20,000 shares were granted. 10,000 of these options
vest in equal monthly installments over the next 60 months after the date of
grant. The remaining 10,000 of options vested on March&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(10) These options
were granted on May&nbsp;4, 1999. The options vest 20% on the first anniversary
of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly installments
over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(11) These options
were originally granted on March&nbsp;1, 2001 with the following vesting
schedule: 20% on the first anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder
vesting in equal monthly installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(12) These options
were granted on November&nbsp;19, 1999. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(13) These options
were originally granted on February&nbsp;17, 2000 with the following vesting
schedule: 20% on the first anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder
vesting in equal monthly installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(14) These options
were originally granted on November&nbsp;15, 2000 with the following vesting
schedule: 20% on the first anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder
vesting in equal monthly installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(15) These options
were granted on January&nbsp;9, 2004. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(16) These options
were granted on October&nbsp;4, 2004. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(17) These options
were originally granted on May&nbsp;8, 2002 with the following vesting
schedule: 20% on the first anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder
vesting in equal monthly installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(18) These options
were granted on June&nbsp;13, 2003. The options vest 20% on the first
anniversary of the grant date, with the remainder vesting in equal monthly
installments over the next 48 months.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(19) These options
were issued in connection with the Company&#146;s voluntary stock option exchange
program. Under the program, eligible employees were given the option to cancel
each outstanding option granted to them at an exercise price greater than or
equal to $20 per share, in exchange for a new option to buy 0.8 shares of the
Company&#146;s common stock to be granted on June&nbsp;5, 2003, six months and one
day from December&nbsp;4, 2002, the expiration date of the offer, and the date
the old options of participating employees were cancelled. There was no credit
given for option vesting during the period between cancellation of the
outstanding option and the grant of the new option.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(20) On September&nbsp;26,
2003, options to purchase 25,000 shares were granted. These options vest in
equal monthly installments over the next 60 months after the date of grant.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(21) On
October&nbsp;17, 2003, options to purchase 25,000 shares were granted. These
options vest in equal monthly installments over the next 60 months after the
date of grant.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\10002229234_D10181_1981728\9971-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 00:24 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Option Exercises
and Stock Vested<a name="OptionExercisesAndStockVested_222616"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes all stock options exercised and value realized upon
exercise, and all stock awards vested and value realized upon vesting, by
Advent&#146;s named executive officers during fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="216" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:162.05pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The value realized
equals the difference between the option exercise price and the fair market
value of Advent common stock on the date of exercise, multiplied by the number
of shares for which the option was exercised.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>No
stock awards vested during fiscal 2006.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pension Benefits<a name="PensionBenefits_222628"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advent&#146;s named executive
officers received no benefits in fiscal 2006 from Advent under defined pension
or defined contribution plans other than the tax qualified 401(k)&nbsp;Plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nonqualified
Deferred Compensation<a name="NonqualifiedDeferredCompensation_222630"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advent&#146;s named executive officers received no benefits
in fiscal 2006 from Advent under nonqualified deferred compensation plans.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\10002229234_D10181_1981728\9971-1-dm.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 00:24 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 3.5pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Potential Payment Upon Termination or
Change-in-Control<a name="PotentialPaymentUponTerminationOr_000715"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 9.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The table below summarizes
the estimated value of severance and change-of-control benefits for each of the
named executive officers as of December&nbsp;31, 2006 under the Advent
Executive Severance Plan (filed as Exhibit&nbsp;10.13 to Form&nbsp;10-K
for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005). The actual amount to be paid out
can only be determined at the time of such executive&#146;s separation from the
Company:</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 9.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Post-Termination
or Change-of-Control Incremental Value Transfer<a name="PostterminationOrChangeofcontrolI_000718"></a></font></b></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
   <td width="83" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:62.2pt;">
   <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:7.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
   <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:7.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
   </td>
   <td width="233" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:174.4pt;">

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.1pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Executives receive 12 months of salary for any
involuntary termination (unrelated and related to change-of-control). Payments
are made monthly over the relevant twelve-month period subject to the
individual signing a release of claims in favor of the Company. Executives
receive 6 months salary for termination due to death or disability. Payments
are made monthly over the relevant six-month period.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.1pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Represents company portion of healthcare premium.
Executives receive 12 months of healthcare continuation for any involuntary
termination and 6 months of healthcare coverage for termination due to death or
disability.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.1pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Executives receive 12 months vesting acceleration on
outstanding equity awards for involuntary termination unrelated to a
change-of-control and 30 months vesting acceleration for termination related to
a change-of-control. Calculations are based on outstanding equity awards as of December&nbsp;31,
2006 and a year-end stock price of $35.29.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.1pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Under the Plan, executives do not receive any gross-up
payments; parachute payments under Section&nbsp;280G are either delivered in
full or delivered as to such lesser extent which would result in no portion of
the severance benefits being subject to excise tax under Section&nbsp;4999,
whichever provides the best after-tax result to the executive. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco is the only executive with severance payments exceeding
the Section&nbsp;280G &#147;safe harbor.&#148; Her best after-tax result is to reduce her
severance by approximately $80,000 so that her parachute payments do not exceed
the Section&nbsp;280G limits.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\9923561439_D10181_1981606\9971-1-do.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:57 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Equity Compensation
Plan Information<a name="EquityCompensationPlanInformation_000626"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes as of December&nbsp;31, 2006, the number of
outstanding equity awards granted to employees, directors and non-employees, as
well as the number of equity awards remaining available for future issuance,
under the Company&#146;s compensation plans:</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="214" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:160.8pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5,558,405</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="35" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:26.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)(2)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="26" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20.08</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="26" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.0pt;">

  <td width="55" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:41.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="49" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:36.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

</div>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes 265,949 shares
of common stock subject to RSU&#146;s that will entitle each holder to the issuance
of one share of common stock for each unit that generally vest over 4 years.
Also, includes 546,724 shares of SAR&#146;s. A SAR is the right to receive the
appreciation in fair market value of common stock between the exercise date and
the date of grant and generally vests over 5 years. Upon exercise, SAR&#146;s will
be settled in shares of Advent common stock.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Excludes purchase rights
accuring under the 2005 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#147;2005 ESPP&#148;).</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Calculated without
taking into account 265,949 shares of common stock subject to outstanding RSU&#146;s
that will become issuable as those units vest, without any cash consideration
or other payment required for such shares.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes 1,817,051
shares available for future issuance under the 2005 ESPP.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts correspond to
Advent&#146;s 1998 Non-statutory Stock Option Plan, described below.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our 1998 Non-statutory
Stock Option Plan, which was not subject to stockholder approval, was adopted
in 1998. On February&nbsp;26, 2007, the Board terminated the 1998 Non-Statutory
Stock Option Plan. This plan permitted the grant of options to purchase up to
300,000 shares to be granted to eligible employees. Officers and members of the
Board of Directors were not eligible to participate in this plan. The plan was
intended to help the Company attract and retain outstanding individuals in
order to promote the Company&#146;s success. Only non-statutory stock options were
able to be granted under the plan. The plan was administered by the Board of
Directors. See Note 9 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements, contained
in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K/A for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006, for a further description of the terms of the plan.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\9923561439_D10181_1981606\9971-1-do.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:57 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">BENEFICIAL SECURITY
OWNERSHIP OF MANAGEMENT<br>
AND CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS<a name="BeneficialSecurityOwnershipOfMana_000640"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table sets forth the beneficial ownership of Common Stock of the
Company as of March&nbsp;23, 2007 for the following: (i)&nbsp;each person or
entity who is known by the Company to own beneficially more than 5% of the
outstanding shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock; (ii)&nbsp;each of the Company&#146;s
directors or nominees for director; (iii)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s Chief Executive
Officer and each of the officers (&#147;Named Officers&#148;) named in the Summary
Compensation Table on page&nbsp;26 hereof; and (iv)&nbsp;all directors and
executive officers of the Company as a group.</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Less than 1%</p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\9923561439_D10181_1981606\9971-1-do.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:57 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(1) The number and percentage of shares beneficially owned is determined
under rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;), and the
information is not necessarily indicative of beneficial ownership for any other
purpose. Under such rules, beneficial ownership includes any shares as to which
the individual has sole or shared voting power or investment power and also any
shares which the individual has the right to acquire within sixty days of March&nbsp;23,
2007 through the exercise of any stock option or other right. Unless otherwise
indicated in the footnotes, each person has sole voting and investment power
(or shares such powers) with respect to the shares shown as beneficially owned.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(2) The total number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock outstanding
as of March&nbsp;23, 2007 was 26,982,974.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(3) This information was obtained from filings made with the SEC
pursuant to Sections 13(d), 13(f)&nbsp;or 13(g)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(4) 5,766,600 of the shares of common stock are owned directly by SPO
Partners II, LP and indirectly by SPO Advisory Parters, LP in its capacity as
the sole general partner of SPO Partners and SPO Advisory Corp., in its
capacity as the sole general partner of SPO Advisory. 644,700 of the shares of
common stock are owned directly by San Francisco Partners II, LP and indirectly
by SF Advisory Partners, LP in its capacity as the sole general partner of SF
Partners LP and SPO Advisory Corp., in its capacity as the sole general partner
of SF Advisory.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(5) Includes 4,388,547 shares of common stock benefically owned by
ClearBridge Advisors, LLC, 152,154 shares of common stock beneficially owned by
ClearBridge Asset Management,&nbsp;Inc., and 35,000 shares of common stock
benefically owned by Smith Barney Fund Management LLC, as jointly reported on
Schedule 13G/A filed on February&nbsp;6, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(6) Ms.&nbsp;DiMarco is President and Chief Executive Officer of the
Company. Share amounts include 1,695,154 shares of common stock held in the
name of DiMarco/Harleen Revocable Living Trust, 154,827 shares of common stock
held in the name of DiMarco/Harleen 1996 Charitable Trust, 3,504 shares held in
the name of the DiMarco/Harleen 1995 Children&#146;s Trust, 52,224 shares held in
the name of the Stephanie DiMarco Annuity Trust DTD 1/23/03, 52,224 shares held
in the name of the James B. Harleen Annuity Trust DTD 1/23/03 and 2,152 shares
held in the Pauline DiMarco Irrevocable Trust in which Stephanie DiMarco and
James Harleen disclaim beneficial ownership. In addition, includes options to
purchase 335,806 shares of common stock and SAR&#146;s to acquire 4,788 shares of
common stock exercisable within 60 days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(7) Includes 6,411,300 shares held by SPO Partners&nbsp;&amp; Co., a
company in which Mr.&nbsp;Scully serves as a managing director and options to
purchase 45,000 shares of common stock exercisable by Mr.&nbsp;Scully within 60
days of March&nbsp;23, 2007. 5,766,600 of the shares of common stock are owned
directly by SPO Partners II, LP and indirectly by SPO Advisory Parters, LP in
its capacity as the sole general partner of SPO Partners and SPO Advisory
Corp., in its capacity as the sole general partner of SPO Advisory. 644,700 of
the shares of common stock are owned directly by San Francisco Partners II, LP
and indirectly by SF Advisory Partners, LP in its capacity as the sole general
partner of SF Partners LP and SPO Advisory Corp., in its capacity as the sole
general partner of SF Advisory.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(8) Includes options to purchase 26,375 shares of common stock
exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(9) Includes options to purchase 37,500 shares of common stock
exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(10) Share amount includes 7,500 shares held by the Kirsner Family Trust
and options to purchase 22,000 shares of common stock exercisable within sixty
days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\fc\9923561439_D10181_1981606\9971-1-do.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 23:57 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(11) Includes options to purchase 42,500 shares of common stock
exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(12) Share amount include 19,200 shares held by the Wendell G.&nbsp;&amp;
Ethel S. Van Auken Trust and options to purchase 56,500 shares of common stock
exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(13) Share amount include 63,000 shares held by the Zuendt Family Trust.
Includes options to purchase 26,500 shares of common stock exercisable within
sixty days March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(14) Includes options to purchase 53,550 shares of common stock and SAR&#146;s
to acquire 2,359 shares of common stock exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23,
2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(15) Includes options to purchase 132,268 shares of common stock
exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(16) No longer an executive officer of the Company as of March&nbsp;23,
2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(17) Includes options to purchase 179,917 shares of common stock and SAR&#146;s
to acquire 1,297 shares of common stock exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23,
2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(18) Includes 4,000 common shares held by the Lily S. Chang Charitable
Remainder Trust and 219,871 held by the Lily S. Chang Trust. In addition,
includes options to purchase 292,666 shares of common stock and SAR&#146;s to
acquire 1,297 shares of common stock exercisable within sixty days of March&nbsp;23,
2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(19) Includes options to purchase 1,309,333 shares of common stock and
stock appreciation rights to acquire 10,590 shares of common stock exercisable
within sixty days of March&nbsp;23, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(20) As of March&nbsp;23, 2007, the executive officers listed below each
held SAR&#146;s. A SAR is the right to receive the appreciation in fair market value
of common stock between the exercise date and the date of grant and generally
vests over 5 years. Upon exercise, SAR&#146;s will be settled in shares of Advent
common stock. Before taxes, the number of shares of common stock issuable from
SAR&#146;s exercisable within 60 days of March&nbsp;23, 2007 for the executive
officers listed below was as follows:</p>
